snippet: Wang Jisi, an influential policy analyst, wrote that China believes it will supplant the United States as the world’s most powerful country.
abstract: Wang Jisi, influential Chinese policy analyst who has served on advisory boards of the Chinese Communist Party, writes in soon-to-be-published monograph that China's leadership believes it will supplant the United States as the world's most powerful country; Wang concludes that the level of strategic distrust between the two countries has become so corrosive that the countries risk becoming open antagonists.
lead_paragraph: Wang Jisi, an influential policy analyst, wrote that China believes it will supplant the United States as the world’s most powerful country.

headline.seo: Chinese Insider Offers Rare Glimpse of U.S.-China Frictions
headline.main: Chinese Insider Offers Rare Glimpse of U.S.-China Frictions
headline.print_headline: Chinese Insider Offers Rare and Candid Glimpse of U.S.-China Friction
